lorebooks.name: Hellaverse
lorebooks.description: Home of Hazbin Hotel and Helluva Boss.
lorebooks.creator: anonymous

1.content:
Based on the shows Hazbin Hotel, and Helluva Boss.

Hell — is inhabited by a population of indigenous hellborn: entities that were born in Hell, and sinners: Humans who have died and have had their souls sent to Hell.  Hell's geography is divided into Seven Rings (Pride, Wrath, Gluttony, Greed, Lust, Envy, and Sloth). Each ring possesses its unique atmosphere, such as the Pride Ring possessing a permanently red sky, and the Lust Ring which has a blue sky.

Travel — Hellborn demons have the ability to traverse across any of the rings, made easily accessible via an extensive elevator network, whereas sinner demons are confined to the top-most ring, the Pride Ring, by methods and reasons unknown.

Society — Hell's society is incredibly chaotic due to the unstable and hostile disposition of its populace. There aren't many rules in the world as it's kind of like a free-for-all and in constant anarchy, but despite this, the inhabitants of Hell have their law system, and there are rules set in place by the Angels and Hell's royal family. The realm also appears to be capable of providing and maintaining rudimentary public services.

Exterminations — Hell suffers from mass overpopulation which Exorcists from Heaven attempt to solve through the exterminations, which is a mass genocide of its inhabitants. These are conducted primarily to reduce Hell's sinner population, leaving Hellborn denizens unharmed as per a deal Lucifer made with Heaven's leadership. 

Hierarchy (most to least powerful) — 
Lucifer Morningstar - The King of Hell
Lilith - The Queen of Hell
Charlie Morningstar - The Princess of Hell
The Seven Deadly Sins
The Ars Goetia - Prince Stolas and other demons with royal status
Overlords - Demons who wield considerable power/influence in the Pride Ring
Sinners - The damned souls of deceased humans
Hellborn demons - Succubi, Incubi, and other species of hellborn demons
Imps and Hellhounds - The bottom of Hell's society

2.content:
Pride Ring — The first and topmost ring within Hell. Sinners are confined to and can only exist in this ring, however, like the other rings in Hell, the Pride Ring is accessible and traversable by Hellborn species.
The Pride Ring has numerous cities that are overpopulated by the countless sinner demons who are condemned to Hell after their deaths on Earth. The sky has been shown to be red colored that shifts to have a dark reddish-purple hue at night.
This ring experiences yearly attacks by the Exorcists in order to quell the overpopulation crisis. Also from this ring the pentagram moon and Heaven are visible in the sky.

Locations — 
Pentagram City
Rosie's Emporium
V Tower
Heaven Embassy
Clock Tower
Devil's Diner
Mimzy's Club
Cannibal Town
Imp City

3.content:
Greed Ring — The Greed Ring appears to be a rundown city and industrial area with rampant criminal and gang activity. The sky has been shown to be green colored that shifts to have a blue hue at night with red stars, and a spinning green coin moon.
There are countless factories and smokestacks as well as garbage and pollution all around, however there are also small sections of upscale suburban housing showing no signs of urban decay and little lack of maintenance.

Locations — 
Loo Loo Land
Notamafia Town
Crimson's mansion
Ransom
Mammon Theatre

4.content:
Wrath Ring — The Wrath Ring appears to be a largely rural area with an old western style and home to many hellish beasts. The sky has been shown to be orange colored that shifts to have a pinkish-red hue in the afternoon and a purplish-red at night.
There are many volcanoes with orbs of lava floating above them, as well as old mine shafts and railroad tracks. It is also mentioned that the inhabitants' labor feeds the citizens of Hell which may imply there are many farmlands around.

Locations — 
Millie's hometown
Rough n' Tumbleweed Ranch
Lin and Joe's house
Harvest Moon Festival arena
Moxxie's hometown
Hideaway Motel
Striker's mine shaft
Ragesburg

5.content:
Lust Ring — The Lust Ring appears to be a large city with many neon signs attached and many have sexual motifs. The sky has been shown to be blue colored, and despite the many lights stars can be seen.
The buildings around Asmodeus' Tower appear to be tall and have many skyscrapers with large neon signs whilst the buildings nearby Ozzie's are much smaller in size and are far from the taller ones.

Locations — 
Asmodeus's Tower
Asmodeus's Factory
Ozzie's

6.content:
Sloth Ring — The Sloth Ring appears to be a large city that most prominently includes medical buildings such as hospitals and clinics. The sky has been shown to be light pinkish colored.
There also seems to be some floating islands throughout the sky, some with buildings on top, some have pink waterfalls flowing from them, and some have trees on them.

Locations — 
St. An's Hospital

7.content:
Gluttony Ring — 
The Gluttony Ring has uniquely shaped buildings within a large, lush green forest with a constant green fog moving throughout. The sky has been shown to be yellow colored with a hexagonal pattern across it.
The most common trees of the forest have blue bark and red eyes but there are also more tropical looking trees producing red goop from the leaves. Many of the buildings seen have a wavy-shaped structure while the roads have a hexagonal pattern across them.

Locations — 
Beezlebub's Mansion

8.content:
Pentagram City — 
The Pentagram is the main city in HelI. It is separated into different sections and there are many different places of interest such as casinos, nightclubs, adult film studios, brothels, restaurants, television stations, and hotels, among which is the Hazbin Hotel.

Demons have their businesses in these places, where they are allowed to sell everything from cigarettes to drugs, however, there are others who resort to the black market, gathering and repurposing the discarded weapons of the Exorcists left behind during the cleanse.

There is a Clock Tower located in the city, which serves as a counter for the 365 days that pass until the Exorcists return for the next Extermination.

Due to the annual cleanse, there are turf wars to dominate the spaces that were wanted and without owners. 

Locations — 
Hazbin Hotel
Rosie's Emporium
Porn Studios
V Tower
666 News Studio
Klub Kaiju
Club Hell 666
Clock Tower
Pot Shop
Devil's Diner
Mimzy's Club
Killer Club
Nightmare Night Club
Evil Donuts
The Red Room Cocktails
Jackpot Hotel
Radio Hacks
Heaven Embassy

9.content:
Charlie Morningstar — Charlotte Morningstar, more commonly known as Charlie, is the Hellborn princess of Hell, the and founder of the Hazbin Hotel.
The estranged daughter of Lucifer, Charlie wants to do right by her kingdom and find a way to redeem Sinners into Heaven through rehabilitation.
Charlie is compassionate and empathetic to a fault, feeling genuinely upset at the idea of harm coming to others.

Vaggie — Vaggie is a pragmatic and cautious angel who devotes a great deal of her time towards attempting to support Charlie with her vision for the hotel, as well as guide her away from as much trouble or humiliation as possible.
Skilled in combat and very protective of her girlfriend, Charlie Morningstar, Vaggie is tough but has a heart of gold.

Angel Dust — Angel is brash and sarcastic, with a quick, sharp wit. He will often use these traits to deflect criticism or insults, and side-step responsibility. He will switch between playful and destructive as he pleases, and his humor tends to be crude and crass, with an emphasis on dirty jokes and innuendos, which he feels is expected of him and actively plays into. 
A famous porn star and the first sinner the hotel is attempting to redeem. But his selfish actions of using the hotel as a rent-free living space threaten to jeopardize Charlie's dream.

Alastor — Alastor, also known as The Radio Demon, is a sinner demon and one of the many powerful Overlords of Hell. He is the wickedly charismatic demon who has offered to assist Charlie in her endeavors, albeit, for his own amusement.
Alastor stands out for his well maintained, amiable persona. He gives a first-impression of a good-natured and charming man, wearing a permanently wide grin on his face at all times. His behavior, mannerisms, and even his voice are similar to an old-fashioned radio announcer and speaks with a transatlantic accent, often using quaint anachronisms.
This playful dandyish exterior, however, obscures a much darker side to him - one with high levels of self-importance - and he will not hesitate to use physical violence when others don't act in line with his very particular values or expectations. He is narcissistic, and he does not see many people quite up to his level.

Husk — Husk is a grumpy, lazy, and somewhat apathetic old sinner whose interests in Hell now lie mostly in gambling, parlor tricks, and prolific drinking.
He can be gruff, standoffish and sarcastic, with a propensity to swear. Despite this, he is also surprisingly patient and able to take a lot of outlandish events in his stride, electing to just drink his problems away later.

Niffty — Niffty is hyper, spontaneous, and agile, being very quick on her feet. She is easily entertained, easily distracted, and easily excitable. She dislikes when there is a mess in any room, and has a fixation on men in general. However, she appears to only like "bad boys". She isn't afraid to get dirty, and enjoys cleaning everyone's messes with a gleeful, yet creepy charm.

Sir Pentious — Sir Pentious is bombastic, flamboyant, short-tempered, temperamental, and persistent, his personality appearing to take cues from classic "mustache-twirling" stock villains. He takes tremendous pride in his grandiose ideas of how evil and cunning he is, at one point even outright declaring "I'm so evil!".
He uses his mechanical genius to build weapons, such as a cannon and his airship. However, he is more than capable of showing remorse, and has a sense of honor.

10.content:
Blitzo Buckzo —  Blitzo is a bombastic, big-talking, and sardonic imp. He is high energy and career-focused, having recently started his own company, something that's noted to be rare for an imp to achieve.
He is very invested in the company's success and willing to make many personal sacrifices to achieve it. However, despite his enthusiasm to break out of the lowly social position his species is assigned in Hell. He is also, in many ways, wildly unprofessional and scattershot in his methods.
Despite his status as his company's sole director, he can frequently behave in ways that are immature, self-absorbed, and even disrespectful towards his employees, affecting their level of respect for him.

Moxxie Knolastname — Moxxie Knolastname is an assassin at I.M.P, and Millie's husband
He is the straight man weapons expert of the I.M.P gang who tends to be the most rational of the group, but is often treated as the butt of the joke.
Despite being a murder-for-hire imp,  Moxxie is queasy with unnecessary killing beyond their targets. He also is uncomfortable with the idea of killing targets who have families, and attempts to give people second chances.

Mildred "Millie" Knolastname — Millie is a very lively and cheerful individual. Often with a smile on her face and rarely standing still, she is a clear extrovert and is not afraid to speak her mind. This is regardless to whether it's expressing her excitement or flipping off a co-worker.
As the bruiser for I.M.P, she is shown to enjoy her job. Her meek exterior appearance belies a tough and very violent skillset. 

Loona — Loona is a cynical and choleric young-adult Hellhound, who was adopted from an orphanage by Blitzo when she was nearing eighteen years of age. Loona is lazy and shows little interest in matters that are going on around her. She also has a short-fuse temper and is often rude and apathetic toward her colleagues, particularly Moxxie, though her ire seems otherwise indiscriminate. When not looking at her phone, Loona is usually scowling at anyone in view.

Prince Stolas Goetia — Stolas gives the immediate impression of someone regal and ostentatious, as would be expected for a royal of his station. He dresses in clothing befitting his role, and his mansion is decadent, containing many large, elaborately framed portraits of himself and his small family.
Underneath these dignified trappings, however, Stolas is shown to be a flamboyant, dramatic, eccentric, and often giddy person. Someone who does not take his royal reputation as seriously as the people around him expect him to, and is prone to act quickly on his easily excitable emotions.
Stolas is very unhappily married to Stella, and father of Octavia.

Stella Goetia — Stella seems to be very temperamental about her husband's infidelity to the point of verbally and almost physically attacking him while screaming, breaking a lot of possessions and even assaulting an imp butler.
Given her choice of words during her argument with Stolas, it seems she is very classist, as she is not only furious at his infidelity but also at his debasement in position, choice of lovers and actions, since she berated him for acting like a plebeian.

Octavia — Octavia's attitude is that of a cynical, stark teenager. She favors morbid topics like listening to and writing depressing emotional songs and collecting taxidermy of monstrous animals.
She is a person of few words, but she does highly value her privacy. Her overt observable attitudes suggest a personality of a negative, pessimistic, and sarcastic individual.

Verosika — As a succubus demon, Verosika is actively seductive and flirtatious, attributes she integrates into her famous popstar persona as a means of manipulation. Despite her status as a star, her fame, and her confidence, she also appears somewhat jaded and is nursing a drinking problem, something she has previously been to rehab for.

Striker — Striker is an arrogant, prideful, violent, ruthless, and sadistic Imp. He views himself as superior to most of his own kind, having no hesitation to mock and belittle those he views as being beneath him, both physically and mentally.
He holds a deep hatred of the nobility of Hell, deriding them as bluebloods who treat Imps as a lesser class. Because of this, Striker gleefully takes the opportunity to assassinate demons of a higher social standing to prove himself as superior.

Fizzarolli — Fizzarolli is a theatrical demon, with a fast-talking demeanor and a crude sense of humor. Extremely vulgar in nature, he constantly makes sexual jokes and puns.  He is especially condescending towards Blitzo, with whom he has a bad history with.
Despite his normal jovial nature Fizzarolli suffers from extreme self-worth and self-image issues, the latter of which mostly originating from the severe injuries he received from a circus fire that he was involved in when he was younger. Because of this, he feels like he needs to do whatever Mammon tells him to do, as he feels he must repay the man for all the fame and success being his brand figure has brought, despite how horribly he is treated. He also believes unless he keeps propitiating the fame and admiration he will be nothing and will lose Asmodeus, as he's only ever seen him as he claims it "his best", and believes he is barely worthy of working with a king of sin because of his disfigurement.

0.name: Jacq
0.content:
<Jacq>

Name: Jacq
Role: Biology teacher at Uva Academy, homeroom teacher
Pokédex app developer
Aura Class: Liminal

Appearance:
- Purple hair, gray eyes, black hexagon glasses
- White lab coat over purple shirt
- Carries Rotom Phone in shirt pocket
- Wears purple sweatpants and white/purple sandals

Personality:
- Friendly, amiable, approachable
- Sweet, corny, greets people with "Hello, hello!"
- Calls students "raggamuffins"
- Pleasant, positive aura
- Easygoing and optimistic

Pokémon Team:
- Arcanine (Lv. 65, Male, Intimidate): Flare Blitz, Play Rough, Close Combat, Psychic Fangs
- Lurantis (Lv. 65, Female, Leaf Guard): Leaf Blade, Leech Life, Night Slash, Brick Break
- Swalot (Lv. 65, Male, Liquid Ooze): Fire Punch, Toxic, Ice Punch, Protect
- Mudsdale (Lv. 65, Female, Stamina): Earthquake, Heavy Slam, Stone Edge, Close Combat
- Slowbro (Lv. 65, Male, Oblivious): Psychic, Surf, Flamethrower, Light Screen
- Farigiraf (Lv. 66, Female, Armor Tail): Psychic, Thunderbolt, Energy Bolt, Shadow Bolt (Terastallizes first)

Mannerisms:
- Often lost in his own thoughts and research
- Greets everyone cheerfully with signature "Hello, hello!"
- Makes corny jokes and puns frequently
- Very animated facial expressions and gestures

[Assistant Note: Include Jacq as an NPC, writing from his perspective.]

</Jacq>

1.name: Paldea
1.content:
<Paldea>

Description:
- Based on Iberian Peninsula (Spain, Portugal, Andorra)
- Inspired by Spanish/Portuguese culture, architecture, food, music
- Locals occasionally use Spanish language
- No traditional routes; divided into 4 provinces with 3 areas each (except South has 6)
- Great Crater at center containing Area Zero

Locations:
12 total cities/towns across 4 provinces
(No need for random encounters for overview region lore)

[Assistant Note: Reference architectural styles, cuisine, music, language when describing Paldean settlements and culture.]

</Paldea>

2.name: South Province Area One
2.content:
<South_Province_Area_One>

Description:
- Valley surrounding Los Platos town in South Province
- West of South Province Area Five, east of Area Four
- Connects to Poco Path (south) and Mesagoza (north)

Notable Locations:
- Los Platos town
- Mesagoza (South) Pokémon Center
- Grasswither Shrine

Pokémon Encounters (levels 3-8):

<choose>
- Azurill
- Buizel
- Chewtle
- Fidough
- Happiny
- Hoppip
- Igglybuff
- Lechonk
- Magikarp
- Pachirisu
- Psyduck
- Scatterbug
- Skwovet
- Tarountula
- Wiglett
- Wingull
</choose>

[Assistant Note: When any character enters this location in the story, randomly select one Pokémon encounter from the <choose> list.]

</South_Province_Area_One>

3.name: East Province
3.content:
<East_Province>

Description:
- Located in eastern region of Paldea
- Terrain divided between grassy plains, rocky mining area, small forest
- Contains several rivers, ponds and beaches
- East Paldean Sea has a sandbar and two islands

Settlements:
- Two unnamed towns
- Major city with striking skyline (unnamed)

Pokémon Encounters:
None listed

[Assistant Note: When characters travel through East Province, describe the appropriate terrain and settlements based on their location]

</East_Province>

4.name: West Province
4.content:
<West_Province>
Located in the western region of Paldea is a city, a town, and a port. The region is mostly hilly and contains a few small rivers as well as a couple ponds and beaches. In the center of the region is a large desert located just south of a cavernous overhanging rock formation supported by massive natural pillars. The western sea contains a few areas with large outcrops and protrusions as well as smaller rocky islets.
</West_Province>

5.name: North Province
5.content:
<North_Province>

Description:
- Northern region of Paldea
- Contains a snowy mountain with a town and hand-shaped cliff
- Mountain is tallest in Paldea

Notable Locations:
- Snowy mountain town
- Glaseado Mountain (tallest mountain)
- Glaseado's Grasp cliff formation (resembles a hand)

To the West:
- Large lake with massive waterfalls (Casseroya Lake)
- Sparsely wooded nature trail (Socarrat Trail)

To the East:
- Rugged region
- Bamboo grove
- Waterfalls and ponds
- 3 Casseroya Watchtowers around a large pond

To the North:
- North Paldean Sea
- Gracia Stones rock pillar formation (northwest)
- Sandbars and rocky islets (north/northeast)

[Assistant Note: Describe wintry environment and landmarks when characters visit the North Province mountain town Glaseado.]

</North_Province>

6.name: Great Crater of Paldea
6.content:
<Crater>

Description:
- Massive crater in central Paldea region
- Surrounded by ring of mountains
- Contains Area Zero, the origin of Terastal phenomenon

Notable Locations:
- Zero Gate in northwestern mountains (primary entrance to Area Zero)
- Area Zero accessible by dropping through clouds after initial visit

Special Encounters:
- Rayquaza (after acquiring Rayquaza Treat)
- Rayquaza respawns 1 hour after defeat if game is rebooted

Pokémon Encounters:

<choose>
- Garchomp
- Magnezone
- Rayquaza (with Rayquaza Treat)
</choose>

[Assistant Note: When any character enters the Crater in the story, randomly select one Pokémon from the <choose> list to encounter]
</Crater>

7.name: Uva Academy
7.content:
<Uva_Academy>
Located in Mesagoza, Paldea's oldest school. Multi-age classes. Large outdoor staircase entrance.
Notable Areas: Entrance hall, cafeteria, school store, biology lab, art room, home ec room, staff room, director's office, nurse's office, schoolyard, dorms.
Staff: Director Clavell, Nurse Miriam, teachers Jacq, Dendra, Raifort, Saguaro, Salvatore, Tyme, Hassel.
Courses: Biology, languages, battle studies, math, home economics, history.
Adri's Courses: Biology, math, physics, battle studies, history, Spanish.
</Uva_Academy>

8.name: Paldea League
8.content:
<Paldea_League>

Description:
- The regional Pokémon League organization of Paldea
- Trainers challenge the 8 Gyms in any order to obtain badges
- Those with 8 badges take the Champion Assessment at headquarters
- Goal is to complete assessment and earn Champion Rank

Gym Details:
- No mandated sequence for challenging the 8 Gyms
- Each Gym has a type specialty and Gym Leader
- Gyms are located in various towns around Paldea
- Earning a Gym's Badge proves mastery over their type

Champion Assessment:
- Multi-phase test taken at Pokémon League headquarters
- Open to Trainers who collect all 8 Gym Badges
- Completing it grants the honored Champion Rank

[Assistant Note: Reference the Gyms and Champion Assessment when involving League challenges]

</Paldea_League>

9.name: Pokémon League
9.content:
<Pokemon_League>

Description:
- Oversees all regional Pokémon battle competitions
- Umbrella group that manages 10 known regional Leagues

Regional Leagues:
- Indigo (Kanto)
- Orange (Orange Archipelago)
- Johto
- Hoenn
- Sinnoh
- Unova
- Kalos
- Alola
- Galar
- Paldea

Requirements:
- Trainers must collect Gym Badges or complete island trials
- Badges show a Trainer has defeated that region's Gym Leaders
- Allows Trainers to qualify for regional competition

Purpose:
- Sets rules and structure for regional-level competitions
- Ensures Trainers meet skill prerequisites through trials
- Facilitates tournaments and events for high-level Trainers

[Assistant Note: Reference to add legitimacy/weight to regional battles and championships.]

</Pokemon_League>
